snippet: The impoverished youths, three sisters and a brother ages 5 to 13, were some of the country’s “left-behind children,” and the police had explored the possibility that their deaths were suicides.
abstract: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang orders officials countrywide to prevent events that led to deaths of four children who died in southwest part of country after drinking pesticides; siblings were so-called left-behind children, whose father was migrant laborer away from home for long periods on jobs, and their mother was absent. .
lead_paragraph: The impoverished youths, three sisters and a brother ages 5 to 13, were some of the country’s “left-behind children,” and the police had explored the possibility that their deaths were suicides.

headline.main: Chinese Premier Urges Officials to Fight Events That Led 4 Children to Drink Pesticide
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Call for Action After ‘Left-Behind Children’ Die
